intro: Beilschmiedia rufohirtella, commonly known as the red-haired beilschmiedia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in the understory of humid forests. The plant is characterized by its smooth, reddish-brown bark and elliptical leaves with a glossy upper surface. It produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically greenish-white in color, followed by dark purple berries. Beilschmiedia rufohirtella is often found in lowland to montane forests, thriving in shaded, moist environments.
